meanings.definition: To release gas from a substance, especially a solid material.
meanings.sent1: When you heat up the rock, it will outgas and release trapped air.
meanings.sent2: The volcano started to outgas as it erupted, spewing out hot gases.
meanings.sent3: The balloon outgassed so much helium that it flew away like a rocket!
meanings.sent4: The old fridge seemed to outgas memories of past meals every time it opened.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's suit had a valve to outgas excess air and maintain proper pressure.

meanings.definition: The process of gas being released from a substance.
meanings.sent1: The outgas from the chemical reaction filled the room with a strange smell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the outgas of comets to learn about their composition.
meanings.sent3: The outgas from the swamp made the air smell like rotten eggs.
meanings.sent4: The outgas of emotions from the crowd was palpable as the team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent5: The outgas of steam from the kettle signaled that the water was boiling.
